status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
RE priority changed to Blocker: I feel the push! Started working on a patch.

Thank you!

Sorry didn't mean to rush you. Just talked with Stack and since we're half way through moving to metrics2 just wanted to make sure that 0.96 wasn't cut with tings sitting half and half.

I've pretty well finished the thrift and master bugs so let me know if you need help on this patch.

Attached initial patch. Created review request at https://reviews.apache.org/r/6775. Notes:

  • I added RegionServerMetrics2 which is to be the placeholder for the rs metrics. I didn't delete the old RegionServerMetrics class. See question below about that
  • I added basic "context construction"-related unit-tests. Unit-tests which test actual metrics changes are blocked by HBASE-6501.
  • I added simple unit-test for metric change for RegionServerMetrics2 to the latest HBASE-6501 patch (it already contained some unit-test for MasterMetrics, which were extracted because of that maven bug). So, you can apply this patch, then the latest form HBASE-6501 and you'll have unit-test that tests actual metrics change.

The Question(s). Current RegionServerMetrics contains a lot of metrics. In initial discussion we concluded that this JIRA issue related effort is about adding placeholder for reworked RS metrics, so that we can fill them in via other JIRA issues (I assume there will be not one).
Q #1: Is this still the plan?
Q #2: Should we leave the name of the class to be RegionServerMetrics2 (this "2" is in one class only) until we fill all metrics in it and then replace the original one (and rename to be without "2")?

P.S. Weird - I didn't see the "grant Apache License ..." radiobuttons while editing this "Attach Files" dialog. Just weird

@Elliot Np, that's OK to be a bit pushed . Esp. given that I distracted a bit with other issues (filters related).

Re help: thanx! If we decide to move all current RegionServerMetrics metrics to new one (called RegionServerMetrics2 in the patch) at once, just so that we can remove old class completely, then I think your help would be very in time. What on your opinion would be the best way to approach moving things from the old class:

  • as we discussed initially in umbrella issue (placeholder + adding reworked metrics in separate JIRAs) or
  • move all existing things (as they are) to new class and then change metrics via separate JIRAs

I'd lean towards the latter one, as this way we will not have "parallel" metrics holders. But at the same time it may be not that big of a deal to have them for a while, as this way we avoid some of the work that will probably be thrown away (we move metrics, then we rework them instead of adding reworked right away).

What are your thoughts?

Updated patch with respect to latest changes in common classes (and the fixed HBASE-6501). Which look good. With factories for metrics sources this looks closer to what I suggested during the initial discussion.

Anyhow, this is what left:

  • replacing (i.e. removing) old Rs Metrics classes
  • adding more metrics in new RS MetricsSource

Elliott, if you have time for the above and have time to complete it as a part of this JIRA issue, feel free to take it from here.. I definitely don't want to be a stopper.
Yep I should have some time for this. Thanks for all of the work it's really in a good place.
Since this will probably end up being a larger patch I'm going to try and keep all the work on github. https://github.com/elliottneilclark/hbase/tree/HBASE-6410

Oh, sorry, forgot to share some minor notes I took when looking at changes in common classes:

1) TestMasterMetricsSourceFactory:

    //This should throw an exception because there is no compat lib on the class path.

    CompatibilitySingletonFactory.getInstance(MasterMetricsSource.class);

This will throw an exception anyways, because now MasterMetricsSource*Factory* is used.

2) MasterMetricsSourceImpl:

public void getMetrics(MetricsBuilder metricsBuilder, boolean all) {

  [...]

    metricsRegistry.snapshot(metricsRecordBuilder, true);

}

Should be metricsRegistry.snapshot(metricsRecordBuilder, all) ?
Same in hadoop-compat2

• Removed all old metrics code.
  • Removed SchemaConfigured
  • Moved lots of atomic longs/ints to use the faster Counter.
  • Added back in metrics 2 code.
  • Added in the ability to clear the jmx cache
  • Made the naming of metrics a little bit more consistent.
  • Added histogram metrics for latency on the server level.
  • The per region lever is just counts to save on space and speed.
  • Made lots of the stats get calculated in an executor that runs every few seconds.
    • Requests per second is a good example of this.
  • Added some metrics per region.
    • The naming format for them is:
      • table.MYTABLENAME.stat
      • table.MYTABLENAME.region.ENCODEDREGIONNAME.stat
    • One aggregating metrics source has multiple sudo sources feeding it.
    • This allows us to have dynamic per region metrics with no hash table look up and no string manipulation after object creation(That is one of the reasons our metrics were so costly).
    • These sudo sources also push metrics that the region and store's compute. If there are more per region metrics that are needed let me know.
https://reviews.apache.org/r/7616/
Rebased on trunk and added the blocked updates time metrics that were added earlier.
Added a unit test for the new metric.

RB is messing me up. Filled out comments on first page twice and it lost them. Here they are:

Usual style is to have spaces around operators (the '+' in this case). No biggie.

Add comment why you are predefining all these strings – because they are used later in h1 and h2 compat modules. There are two places where you define a lump of static strings. Say why – that they will be used downstream in implemenations?

On 'getServerName' in Interfaces... "Was going to say why this in this Interface when its in the Server Interface implemented by Master – then thinking on it, better to explicitly declare what you need in your Interface rather than have a non-declared dependency..."

Remove 'Master' from method names because context is enough... e.g. getStartTime instead of getMasterStartTime. Ditto in the RegionServer wrapper Interface.

For the region wrapper, will there be a day when we should pass the Put object to the updatePut, etc., so it can glean metrics by looking at the actual Put? That is future stuff.

Its createServer and not createGeneral in the factory.

In replication source, fix the bean names. Has HRegionServer instead of RegionServer... in a few places.

Rest bean should be called REST I think rather than Rest or rest.

Latest patch that addresses all of the code comments on RB.

  • Fixed the test failure due to class sizing.
  • Got all the files with the correct header.
  • Cleaned up code formatting.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Region server metrics are now exported through Hadoop's new metrics 2 sub system. Naming and location of MBeans have changed to be more consistent and informative.
